analysis_general: The term "their family orientated team" may implicitly suggest a preference for candidates who fit a certain cultural or social mold.
text: 2 days a week WFH. Permanent. $57k. About the company. This organisation is a diverse and energetic organisation that provides services to support the delivery of training, continuing professional development, and health policy and advocacy on behalf of more than 17, 000 Fellows and 8000 Trainees, across Australia and New Zealand. Our client is looking for a new member to join their family orientated team in this busy and varied role. This person needs to have excellent written and verbal communication skills with outstanding attention to detail and able to manage a busy workload. Work from home flexibility a couple of days a week and full training and support provided. Duties Gain a detailed understanding of program accreditation requirements and identify ways to streamline processes. Create and maintain electronic records, including data entry of applications and assessments of training settings. Prepare briefings and reports to go to the appropriate Committees for determination on accreditation processes and decisions including correspondence to settings of the Committee decision. Evaluate processes and procedures for delivery of accreditation design improvement strategies. Contributing towards projects as required, for example Training Provider Accreditation Renewal, communication campaigns, online resources, business process transformation. Coordinate the reviews and accreditation processes for Basic and Advanced training programs including accreditation criteria. Skills & Experience High level written and oral communication skills, including reports and briefs, policy/process documentation, and presentations Personal characteristics required. Demonstrated ability to prioritise work, meet deadlines, managing a range of complex tasks in a changing work environment while maintaining an attention to detail. Demonstrated ability to plan, support and organise others to ensure the completion of tasks. Ability to work flexibly and demonstrate initiative. How to Apply? If this role sounds like you, click APPLY to submit your resume to Kayleigh at Kinetic or for a confidential call please call 044727878.
metadata:
{"document_id": "Kaggle::techmap::61403caca3938634068779bc::seek_nz", "source": "seek_nz", "country": "NZ", "company": "Kinetic Recruitment", "position": "Education Administrator Accreditation", "notes": "", "original": "
  • 2 days a week WFH
  • Permanent
  • $57k
 
About the company
This organisation is a diverse and energetic organisation that provides services to support the delivery of training, continuing professional development, and health policy and advocacy on behalf of more than 17,000 Fellows and 8000 Trainees, across Australia and New Zealand.
 
Our client is looking for a new member to join their family orientated team in this busy and varied role. This person needs to have excellent written and verbal communication skills with outstanding attention to detail and able to manage a busy workload. Work from home flexibility a couple of days a week and full training and support provided.
 
Duties
  • Gain a detailed understanding of program accreditation requirements and identify ways to streamline processes.
  • Create and maintain electronic records, including data entry of applications and assessments of training settings.
  • Prepare briefings and reports to go to the appropriate Committees for determination on accreditation processes and decisions including correspondence to settings of the Committee decision.
  • Evaluate processes and procedures for delivery of accreditation design improvement strategies.
  • Contributing towards projects as required, for example Training Provider Accreditation Renewal, communication campaigns, online resources, business process transformation.
  • Coordinate the reviews and accreditation processes for Basic and Advanced training programs including accreditation criteria.
 
 
Skills & Experience
  • High level written and oral communication skills, including reports and briefs, policy/process documentation, and presentations Personal characteristics required
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritise work, meet deadlines, managing a range of complex tasks in a changing work environment while maintaining an attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated ability to plan, support and organise others to ensure the completion of tasks.
  • Ability to work flexibly and demonstrate initiative.
 
How to Apply?
If this role sounds like you, click APPLY to submit your resume to Kayleigh at Kinetic or for a confidential call please call 044727878.
 
"}
